subject: Test4: Creating a new system
commitMessage:
Test4: Creating a new system

Change-Id: I9147e7475c12fa7aff5ad6b65a274249ceae57d9
Signed-off-by: jdhanasekar <jdhanasekar@velankanigroup.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1:

User not approved, see admin, no CI

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi Dhanasekar,

Thanks for the patches. 
Few comments:
1. Please split the patch into multiple patches, so that it is easy to review.
2. End goal for us to create a single binary image that works for both daytonax and ethanolx.
Hence, I may have to reject some patches in the course of the review, if specifics for daytonax and ethanolx are not differentiated using a runtime mechanism such as DT overlay.


Just a heads up that going forward, there wont be meta-ethanolx and meta-daytonax, it will just be meta-sp3, re-organization in progress and will be upstreamed soon. Hence, split your patches to help smooth re-organization.

Your contributions are valued and appreciated.

Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Supreeth, this is related to https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/issues/3747 .  Dhanasekar was trying to get something built for daytonax and I didn't have enough visibility into what was happening in order to get something built.  I suggested he push to Gerrit so we could facilitate debug.

Dhanasekar, this will get you past the UBOOT issue.  It looks like obmc-console fails to build due to missing a config file...

Patch Set 1:

Also did: `git mv meta-amd/recipes-phosphor/console/obmc-console/ethanolx meta-amd/recipes-phosphor/console/obmc-console/daytonax`

Patch Set 1:

Also: `git mv meta-amd/recipes-phosphor/logging/phosphor-hostlogger/ethanolx ./meta-amd/recipes-phosphor/logging/phosphor-hostlogger/daytonax`

Dhanasekar, there are a lot of bitbake VARIABLE_ethanolx that likely need to change to _daytonax.

$ git grep _ethanolx | wc -l 
22

Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> Supreeth, this is related to https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/issues/3747 .  Dhanasekar was trying to get something built for daytonax and I didn't have enough visibility into what was happening in order to get something built.  I suggested he push to Gerrit so we could facilitate debug.
> 
> Dhanasekar, this will get you past the UBOOT issue.  It looks like obmc-console fails to build due to missing a config file...

Patrick - Thanks for the heads up. 
Dhansekar - daytonax device tree needs to be up-streamed first, the variable names need to be changed.
Cant mix ethanolx definitions for daytonax.

Follow these steps: https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/development/add-new-system.md

1. Start with meta-daytonax/conf. (with nothing else present in meta-daytonax)
2. It should fail with Linux build or any one of the recipes that is being built in meta-amd folder. since there is not a valid daytonax device tree. For recipes failing in meta-amd folder like console, etc. Look into its respective .bb file or .bbappend, try adding appropriate daytonax definitions.
to get past the build issue.
3. For Linux build failing, devtool modify linux-aspeed and add a dummy daytonax device tree in arch/arm/boot/dts (name should match with conf files).
4. Recompile to make sure it builds, though some or none of the functionality may work.

> to get past the build issue.
> 3. For Linux build failing, devtool modify linux-aspeed and add a dummy daytonax device tree in arch/arm/boot/dts (name should match with conf files).
> 4. Recompile to make sure it builds, though some or none of the functionality may work.

Hi Supreeth,

1.I have started with empty "meta-daytonax/conf", built it "bitbake obmc-phosphor-image" and observing below error, 
 "ERROR: Unable to parse conf/bitbake.conf: [Errno 2] file conf/bitbake.conf not found in /home/user/dhanasekar/BMC/AMD/test01/build".
2. I have added minimal changes, like this,
   a) in local.conf.sample,
    ```
    # This sets the default machine to be qemux86 if no other machine is selected:
    MACHINE ??= "daytonax"
    ```
   b) in bblayers.conf.sample,
   ```
   # LAYER_CONF_VERSION is increased each time build/conf/bblayers.conf
   # changes incompatibly
   LCONF_VERSION = "7"

   BBPATH = "${TOPDIR}"
   BBFILES ?= ""

   BBLAYERS ?= " \
     ##OEROOT##/meta \
   "
   BBLAYERS_NON_REMOVABLE ?= " \  
   "
  c) nothing added to layer.conf.


After running "bitbake obmc-phosphor-image", I am getting below error,

"ERROR:  OE-core's config sanity checker detected a potential misconfiguration.
    Either fix the cause of this error or at your own risk disable the checker (see sanity.conf).
    Following is the list of potential problems / advisories:

    MACHINE=ethanolx is invalid. Please set a valid MACHINE in your local.conf, environment or other configuration file.

"

How are you building it?
. setup daytonax
bitbake obmc-phosphor-image
is the right instruction to build it.

Also, meta-daytonax/conf/layer.conf and other files have ethanolx definitions in them, which is incorrect. There should be no ethanolx definition inside meta-daytonax folder.

Hi Dhanasekar,

I have added the following gerrit reviews which should help build daytonax platform image.
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/40226/1
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/40227/1
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/40228/1
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/40229/1

Start from clean openbmc(master), cherry-pick all the above changes.
Then,
. setup daytonax
bitbake obmc-phosphor-image to build the daytonax image.

However, note that it only builds the image but none of the features may work.
